unnormalised: ## Beyond Bollywood Blockbusters: Why You Should Check Out a Film Festival
normalised: beyond bollywood blockbusters: why you should check out a film festival

unnormalised: Hey cinephiles! Tired of the same old song and dance at your local multiplex? Craving something more than just the latest Karan Johar production (no shade intended, KJo!)? Then it's time to dive into the fascinating world of film festivals.
normalised: hey cinephiles! tired of the same old song and dance at your local multiplex? craving something more than just the latest karan johar production (no shade intended, k j o!)? then it is time to dive into the fascinating world of film festivals.

unnormalised: Think of them as giant melas (fairs) dedicated to the art of filmmaking. Forget the predictable Hollywood or Bollywood fare – film festivals are where you discover hidden gems, indie flicks with a soul, and documentaries that will blow your mind.
normalised: think of them as giant melas (fairs) dedicated to the art of filmmaking. forget the predictable hollywood or bollywood fare – film festivals are where you discover hidden gems, indie flicks with a soul, and documentaries that will blow your mind.

unnormalised: India has a thriving film festival scene. The International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa is probably the biggest and most well-known, attracting filmmakers and fans from all over the globe. But there are tons of others! The Mumbai Film Festival (MAMI) is a fantastic option, showcasing both Indian and international cinema. And don't forget smaller, regional festivals like the Kolkata International Film Festival or the Jaipur International Film Festival. You'll find everything from hard-hitting social dramas to quirky comedies that you won't see anywhere else.

unnormalised: So, why bother attending? Well, for starters, you get to see films before anyone else does! Plus, you might just bump into your favourite director or actor. Imagine chatting with Anurag Kashyap after a screening! Besides the films, festivals are a fantastic place to network, learn about filmmaking, and discuss cinema with other passionate people. Think of the intellectual chai breaks!

unnormalised: It’s not just about the movies either. Many festivals also have workshops, panel discussions, and Q&A sessions with filmmakers. You can learn about everything from scriptwriting to cinematography.

unnormalised: Plus, let's be honest, the atmosphere at a film festival is electric. Imagine spending a week surrounded by people who love movies as much as you do, debating the merits of different films over copious amounts of coffee and samosas. Sounds like a dream, right?
normalised: plus, let's be honest, the atmosphere at a film festival is electric. imagine spending a week surrounded by people who love movies as much as you do, debating the merits of different films over copious amounts of coffee and samosas. sounds like a dream, right?

unnormalised: So, ditch that predictable Friday night movie routine and check out a film festival near you. You might just discover your next favourite filmmaker or a movie that changes your perspective on life. Trust me, it’s worth the Rs. 500-Rs. 2000 registration fee (depending on the festival). You might even need to travel a 100 km or so, but the cinematic journey is totally worth it! Happy watching!
